question.question-text: Why does the student go to see the professor?

answer-list.answer-text: To find out how she did on a project

answer-text.exp: To discuss how a project is to be completed

answer-list.answer-text: To talk about how she could do better in the political science class
To discuss who should be her partner on a project

question.explain-text: In the conversation, the student says I'd like…to talk about the…project for your political science class and I'd…like to do it a bit differently if I could. From this, it can be determined that the student goes to see the professor to discuss how a project is to be completed. The second answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: What does the professor seem to think?

answer-list.answer-text: That it is not a good time to ask a question
That the project was already completed in class
That he will answer any questions in class tomorrow

answer-text.exp: That the student should already understand what to do

question.explain-text: In the conversation, the professor says you have a question? But we talked about the project quite a bit today in class. It can be inferred from this that the professor thinks that the student should already understand what to do. The last answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: The professor has described an assignment. Indicate whether each of these is part of the assignment.

explain-list.explain-text: The student says you said we should get together with another student for the project. This means that it is true that the professor has assigned the students to find a partner. You should therefore click in the YES column.

The professor says you're supposed to choose an issue, one that's interesting to you. This means that it is true that the professor has assigned the students to select an issue. You should therefore click in the YES column.

The professor says you're supposed to…present the issue clearly so everyone understands it. This means that it is true that the professor has assigned the students to present the issue. You should therefore click in the YES column.

The professor says I want you to have a debate, where each one of you presents a different side of the issue and you each argue on the issue from a different perspective. This means that it is true that the professor has assigned the students to debate the issue. You should therefore click in the YES column.

answer-list.answer-text: To have a debate with another student

question.explain-text: In the conversation, the student says I'd rather do the project by myself and I really want to work on this myself, and I'm willing to prepare both sides of the issue in order to work on it alone. From this it can be determined that the student wants to work without a partner. The third answer is therfore the answer to this question.

question.question-text: What reasons does the professor give to say no?

answer-list.answer-text: He wants the students to debate an issue.
He wants the students to work together.
He wants the students to select several partners each.
He wants each to work alone.

question.explain-text: In the conversation, the professor says I want you to actually discuss the issue—to debate it—and you really can't debate an issue yourself and that raises another argument because I really want you to work with another student. From this, it can be determined that the professor says no because he wants the students to debate an issue and he wants the students to work together. The first and second answers are therefore the best answers to this question.
